subject: question about Assert.assertEquals
msgSnippet: Hi, I ve got a problem with the method assertEquals. I ve got the following very simple class Point: public class Point { public Point (int x, int y) { this.x
messageBody:
Hi,

I've got a problem with the method assertEquals.

I've got the following very simple class Point:
public class Point {

public Point (int x, int y) {
this.x = x;
this.y =y;
}


public boolean equals(Point pt){
return (x== pt.x && y == pt.y);
}

private int x, y;
}

and just for training, I woud like to test the method equals, so like
in the tutorial with Money , I write the following PointTest class to
test it from within JUnit:

import junit.framework.TestCase;
import junit.framework.Assert;

public class PointTest extends TestCase {

public PointTest(String arg0) {
super(arg0);
}

public static void main(String args[]) {
junit.textui.TestRunner.run
(PointTest.class);
}

protected void setUp() {
p1 = new Point(2,3);
p2 = new Point (2,3);
}



public void testEquals() {

Assert.assertEquals("Non equal points",p1, new Point
(2,3));

Assert.assertTrue("p1 isn't equal to p1", p1.equals
(new Point(2,3)));

}

private Point p1 , p2;
}


My problem: the second part of test, i.e.

Assert.assertTrue("p1 isn't equal to p1", p1.equals(new Point(2,3)));

works without problems, but it isn't the same case for the following
first assertion:

Assert.assertEquals("Non equal points",p1, new Point(2,3));

And I don't understand why. Given the class assertEquals, we use
polymorphism applied to p1, and so the overriden method equals from
class Point should be used, no?
It looks as the method equals from superclass Object was still used,
that's why the test doesn't succeed: the objects have no the same
reference.

Someone could explain me what I don't understand, please?

Thanks in advance,
Cyr.
